body: @GDmac @kakysha Since you've recently tackled other query cache issues, could you take a look at this one?
Just tested it - address does get escaped, which shouldn't happen.

Ehm, i have just now tested it again. Downloaded the 'dev' version from github.

I have updated the gist, you should now replace the whole file
**system/core/database/DB_query_builder.php**

(or paste in the merge_cache function, starting from line 2553
https://gist.github.com/GDmac/7435165#file-db_query_builder-php-L2553 )
Erm ... could you gist a patch instead? It's really hard to spot any changes like that, especially in a file that has 2.7k lines of code.

was my first try for a patch export from git-tower, so here goes.
https://gist.github.com/GDmac/7435165
Looks like it fixes it, but not sure if it doesn't break anything else considering that you have an empty `else` condition in there with a bunch of comments ...

This is a preliminary test. And i have doubts about my previous PR where variables are only added if they are not present in cache. Should we just add all qb_variables? (probaly not, the original used array_unique, if i recall).

To also add the correct qb_escape value for the accompanying select variable, we need the array index to add that value to the final no_escape array. Maybe a different approach could be to use for(count(qb_variable)) instead of foreach(qb_variable). I will look at this in/after the weekend.

A more basic question, if you cache `select('name',false)` and then later, 
after stop cache, do `select('name', true)` what should codeigniter do?
Should it overwite the cached version? Should it ignore it?
I'm not sure about that last question, but I don't feel like we should be dealing with that anyway - there shouldn't be such cases.
in that case, the else { } part can go

Ok, so before I commit - does this work for you?

https://gist.github.com/narfbg/7600256
Tower.app says fatal at line 50, cannot patch
Tower.app? Line 50 isn't even close to what the patch changes.
"A git error occured, fatal: corrupt patch at line 50"
@kakysha did that work for you? i still get **fatal: corrupt patch at line 50**

Works fine:

```
narf@vaio:~/github/CodeIgniter$ patch -p1 < issue2579.patch 
patching file system/database/DB_query_builder.php
narf@vaio:~/github/CodeIgniter$
```

well, i even updated git to 1.8.4.2 and `git apply issue2579.patch` still doesn't work... WHY?!. 
in the end `patch -p1 < issue2579.patch` worked, i'll look into the patch later.
@GDmac coz git has a bit different patch file syntax
